column2: Coal; briquettes, ovoids and similar solid fuels manufactured from coal
Petroleum oils and oils obtained from bituminous minerals; crude
column5: This value should only include conventional which we call crude oil

column2: Petroleum gases and other gaseous hydrocarbons; liquefied, natural gas
column5: This is actually liquified natural gas, but for a first pass at creating a fossil fuel market we'll lump LNG and gaseous natural gas together

column2: Petroleum gases and other gaseous hydrocarbons; in gaseous state, natural gas
Bituminous or oil shale and tar sands
column5: This is just oil shale and tar sands, which are generally counted as unconventional oil. Depending on IEA's definition we may need to add more.
